ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English infancy, from Old French enfance, from Latin īnfantia ('speechlessness, infancy'), from īnfāns ('child', literally 'not speaking'), from in- ('not') + fārī ('to speak').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The period of life from birth until around the age of one or two, when a child is an infant.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 婴儿时期；幼年期；孩提时代
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Many crucial developmental milestones are reached during infancy.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 许多关键的发展里程碑都是在婴儿时期实现的。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The early stage of the development or existence of something, when it is new and not yet fully formed or established.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The technology is still in its infancy, but it shows great promise.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这项技术仍处于萌芽阶段，但前景广阔。
